About Me

I am a PhD candidate in Geological Sciences at the University of Texas at Austin. I was born and raised in Ankara, Turkey. I completed my undergraduate and Master’s education at Middle East Technical University with a degree in Environmental Engineering.

After graduating from Master’s, I moved to the US by awarded Fulbright Scholarship to pursue my doctoral research.

My research interests are groundwater flow - transport mechanisms, groundwater-surface water interactions and groundwater as a natural resource. I am particulary interested in high-latitude groundwater hydrology. My current focus is understanding groundwater flow and transport dynamics in the coastal permafrost regions in the Arctic.

Water is the driving force of all nature. Leonardo Da Vinci

I am currently working as a research assistant under the supervision of Prof. M. Bayani Cardenas.

Thank You for reading!
